snippet.title: Australian Olympic legend Betty Cuthbert dead at 79
snippet.content:
Betty Cuthbert has passed away.
Share
AUSTRALIAN track and field legend Betty Cuthbert has died aged 79 after a long battle with multiple sclerosis. As an 18-year-old, Cuthbert was one of the stars of the 1956 Olympics in Melbourne, winning three gold medals in the 100m, 200m and 4x100m relay. She set an Olympic record of 11.4 seconds in the 100m and ran the anchor leg as Australia broke the world record in the relay. After injury prevented her from adding to her tally in Rome four years later she added the 400m crown in Tokyo in 1964. She is still the only Olympian - male or female - to have won gold in the 100m, 200m and 400m and only Ian Thorpe (five) has won more gold for Australia. More to come ...
